meanings.definition: Bent or turned backward or downward.
meanings.sent1: The retrorse branches of the tree pointed downward towards the ground.
meanings.sent2: The retrorse hairpin was designed to curve back towards the scalp.
meanings.sent3: The retrorse umbrella kept flipping inside out in the strong wind.
meanings.sent4: Her retrorse attitude towards change hindered her progress in life.
meanings.sent5: The retrorse path led them back to where they started, feeling lost.

meanings.sent1: The retrorse arrow missed its target and flew back in the opposite direction.
meanings.sent2: The retrorse sign pointed back towards the entrance of the museum.
meanings.sent3: The retrorse clock hands seemed to be running in reverse, confusing everyone.
meanings.sent4: His retrorse decision to quit his job made him regret it later.
meanings.sent5: The retrorse gaze of the painting seemed to follow you wherever you went.
